subLabel.preValidation: Provide a company prefix for the management group structure that will be created.

options.text: Enterprise-Scale deployment requires access at the tenant root (/) scope. Visit this link to ensure you have the appropriate RBAC permission to complete the deployment

elements.name: esMgmtGroup
elements.label: Management Group prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a prefix for management group structure, 1-5 characters.

options.text: In this step, you can configure monitoring, security, and auditing settings to be enabled during the setup

elements.name: esMgmtSub
elements.label: Management subscription id
elements.toolTip: Provide the subscription id of an existing, empty subscription that you want to dedicate for management, which will be moved into the management group for platform management.

constraints.validationMessage: A valid subscription id must contain 36 characters.

elements.name: esPlatformLogAnalytics
elements.label: Enable monitoring for your platform and resources
elements.toolTip: If you select 'Yes', a Log Analytics workspace will be deployed in the Management Subscription and a set of Azure Policies will be assigned to ensure Diagnostic Logs from your platform resources logs are collected.

elements.name: esPlatformSecurityLogs
elements.label: Enable collection of Security Logs
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' to collect access and audit logs from Platform subscriptions and resources

elements.name: esPlatformAsc
elements.label: Enable security monitoring for your platform and resources using Azure Security Center
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' and the preferred Tier (Standard or Free) to get Azure Security Center enabled automatically for all your subscriptions.

elements.name: esPlatformCIS
elements.label: Enforce and audit Azure Security Benchmark controls.
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' to enforce and audit CIS benchmark controls in all Platform subscriptions.

steps.name: esConnectivityGoalState
steps.label: Enable Hybrid Connectivity (Hub & Spoke) in your environment

options.text: Hybrid connectivity is required for migration scenarios and/or connectivity to on-premise. You can skip this step if you do not need hybrid connectivity from the start. You will always be able to enable Hybrid Connectivity later on when you needed. Note: Skip this step if you require Azure Virtual WAN.

elements.name: esHS
elements.label: Skip this step
elements.toolTip: Select 'No' if on-premise connectivity is not required.

elements.name: esConnectivitySub
elements.label: Connectivity subscription id
elements.toolTip: Provide the subscription id of an existing, empty subscription that you want to dedicate for connectivity, which will be moved into the management group for platform connectivity.

constraints.validationMessage: A valid subscription id must contain 36 characters.

elements.name: esAddress
elements.label: Address space (required for your Connectivity Hub)
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.1.0/22)

constraints.validationMessage: The virtual hubs network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esGwSubnetAddress
elements.label: Gateway Subnet Address space (required for your Connectivity Hub)
elements.toolTip: Provide the gateway subnet address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.1.0/27)

constraints.validationMessage: The gateway subnet's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: esRegions
elements.label: Region for first virtual hub
elements.toolTip: Select the target region for you connectivity deployment (requires you to provide a subscriptionId for connectivity)

elements.name: esVpnGw
elements.label: Enable VPN connectivity
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a VPN gateway will be deployed

elements.name: esErGw
elements.label: Enable private connectivity using ExpressRoute
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, an Express Route gateway will be deployed

elements.name: esAzFw
elements.label: Deploy a perimeter Firewall in Azure
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, an Azure Firewall will be deployed

elements.name: esFwSubnetAddress
elements.label: Azure Firewall Subnet's Address space
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.1.0/22)

constraints.validationMessage: The Azure Firewall Subnet's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

options.text: Define a Landing Zone template including a set of policies that will ensure workloads will be secure, monitored, and protected according to best practices.

elements.name: esLzTypeName
elements.label: Landing zone definition name
elements.toolTip: Provide a name (up to 10 characters) to assign to this Landing Zone definition.

constraints.validationMessage: A valid subscription id must contain 36 characters. If you don't want to bring a subscription at this point, leave the parameter completely empty.

elements.name: esLzNoPublicEndpoints
elements.label: Prevent my workloads from exposing Public Endpoints
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a set of Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure no Public IPs can be provisioned and that all PaaS services use Private Endpoints

elements.name: esLzLockDownPublicEndpoints
elements.label: Ensure Public Endpoints are Locked Down
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a set of Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure access to your workloads Public Endpoints is locked down.

elements.name: esLzLockDownVnet
elements.label: Ensure my Virtual Networks are locked down
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a set of Azure Policy will be assigned to ensure access Network Security Groups are assigned to your subnets and that IP Forwarding is not allowed.

elements.name: esLzHttps
elements.label: Ensure encryption of Data in Transit (HTTPS)
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a set of Azure Policies will be assigned to ensure your endpoints can only be accessed using an encrypted communication channel (TLS, https, etc.)

elements.name: esLzAzBackup
elements.label: Ensure backup is enabled for all VMs
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, an Azure Policy will be assigned and enable Azure Backup on all VMs in the landing zones.

elements.name: esLzLogAnalytics
elements.label: Enable central monitoring for all Workloads
elements.toolTip: If you select 'Yes', monitoring logs from these Landing Zones' subscriptions and resources will be collected.

elements.name: esLzSecurityLogs
elements.label: Enable collection of Security Logs
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' to collect access and audit logs from these Landing Zones' subscriptions and resources

elements.name: esLzAsc
elements.label: Enable security monitoring using Azure Security Center
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' and the preferred Tier (Standard or Free) to get Azure Security Center enabled automatically for all these Landing Zones.

elements.name: esLzCIS
elements.label: Enforce and audit Azure Security Benchmark controls.
elements.toolTip: Select 'Yes' to enforce and audit CIS benchmark controls in all these Landing Zones.

options.text: You can optionally provide a subscriptionId for your first landing zone.

elements.name: lzDeploySkip
elements.label: Skip provisioning of first Landing Zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected a Landing Zone will not be configured.

elements.name: lzSub
elements.label: Landing zone subscription id
elements.toolTip: Provide the subscription id of an existing, empty subscription that you want to use as landing zone for your workload deployments.

constraints.validationMessage: A valid subscription id must contain 36 characters. If you don't want to bring a subscription at this point, leave the parameter completely empty.

elements.name: lzVnet
elements.label: Provision a Virtual Network within your Landing Zone
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected a Virtual Network will be provisioned and configured.

elements.name: lzVnetAddress
elements.label: Landing Zone Network's Address space
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.1.0/22)

constraints.validationMessage: The Landing Zone network's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: lzVnetRegion
elements.label: Landing Zone Network's Location
elements.toolTip: Select the target region for this Landing Zone

elements.name: lzWAF
elements.label: Deploy a Web Application Firewall
elements.toolTip: If 'Yes' is selected, a Web Application Firewall will be deployed to the Landing Zone

elements.name: lzWAFSubnetAddress
elements.label: Web Application Firewall Subnet's Address space
elements.toolTip: Provide address prefix in CIDR notation (e.g 192.168.1.0/22)

constraints.validationMessage: The Web Application Firewall Subnet's address space, specified as one address prefixes in CIDR notation (e.g. 192.168.1.0/24)

elements.name: lzWAFType
elements.label: Web Application Firewall Front-end Type
elements.toolTip: Specify 'External' if the WAF is expected to provide access to Public Facing Applications
